 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַזְדָּא‎</span> (so [[BDB#Gi|Gi]], with most [[BDB#MSS|MSS]].; [[BDB#Baer|Baer]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אָֽזְדָא‎</span> **adjective** ==sure, assured== (Persian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***azda***</u></abbr>, Sanskrit <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***addhâ***</u></abbr>, 'certain' (Kern<sup>ZDMG 1869, 220</sup>); so first [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>KAT 2 617</sup>; confirmed now by Egyptian Aramaic ([[BDB#RÉS|RÉS]]<sup>361, B 3</sup>) <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הן אזד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎יחעבד מן‎</span> if it is made certain (certified) by, etc.; &gt; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Ki|Ki]] [[BDB#AV|AV]] and others (see Thea) as verb is ***gone***, or (<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אָֽזְדָא‎</span>) ***is going***, from Talmud <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲזַד‎</span> (= <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲזַל‎</span>) ***go away*** ([[BDB#Levy|Levy]]<sup>NHWB i. 50</sup>); so [[BDB#Scheft|Scheft]]<sup>MGWJ 1903, 310</sup> from Zend \* <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***azda***</u></abbr> 'gone,' participle passive of <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***azaiti***</u></abbr> 'go'); — [[Dan.2.5|Dan 2:5]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִלְּתָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִנִּי אַוְדָּא‎</span>, v[[Dan.2.8|Dan 2:8]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּיאַֿזְדָּא מִנִּי מִלְּתָא‎</span> the word is ***assured*** on my part (the thing is fully resolved upon by me: compareSyrver <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; IE <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קַיָּימָא וֶאְמֶת‎</span>); + [[Dan.3.14|Dan 3:14]](see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צְדָא‎</span>).
